item.title: 508 File Manager
item.dc:creator: @SethScape_508 SethScape 508
item.description:
@SethScape_508 wrote:

W00t!! thank you kane i never knew what substring meant! but now i do, ive always had trouble with the substring on filemanager! but now i understand for example for if something is spelt this long " Private:" i put it as substring 8 becuz theres 8 characters, another example if something is spelt this long “lolicopterop:” i put it as substring 13!!! thank you kane! im repping u big time!

thank you dude!!! im serious man i fucken love you now! now i can make very cool things! like i was trying to save a quest i made but i didnt know which substring to put it on!!! but now i do !!! now my quest saves on the filemanager perfectly!!! fuck dude thank you!!!

Read full topic

item.title: 508 File Manager
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

Ehh. Must be doing something else wrong. Sorry didn’t read that part. Well the substring is the letter number in the line, counting zero, so just put the substring at the amount of characters in your line. Try and figure out what else you’re doing wrong though.

Read full topic

item.title: 508 File Manager
item.dc:creator: @SethScape_508 SethScape 508
item.description:
@SethScape_508 wrote:

hello im trying to save things using the file manager but i cannot find a proper substring to save to, here is a code im using in filemanger.java

            } else if (line.startsWith("Private:")) {
                p.Private = Integer.parseInt(line.substring(20));

when i do this save and compile i get no errors, but when i log in and log out it nevers saves the character file i mean it completely resets my character everytime! im trying to figure out which substring i should save this too!!! this is really annoying ive tried substrings 1 - 20!

Read full topic
